alert.note: Alert for Oglala Lakota (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 11 at 6:30PM MDT until May 12 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Oglala Lakota County in southwestern South Dakota... * Until 1230 AM MDT. * At 630 PM MDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, and streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pine Ridge, Porcupine, Kyle, Manderson, Wounded Knee, Batesland, Porcupine Butte Housing, Evergreen, Sharps Corner, Goose Neck Housing, Thunder Valley, Wolf Creek Housing, Lonesome Valley, Calico, Kyle North Route Housing, Wakpamni, Number 4 and Pine Ridge Reservation. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
